meanings.definition: Scraighs (verb): to make a harsh, shrill sound
meanings.sent1: The old door scraighs when it opens slowly.
meanings.sent2: The cat scraighs loudly when it doesn't get its food on time.
meanings.sent3: The rusty swing scraighs in protest as the children play on it.
meanings.sent4: The wind scraighs through the trees, creating an eerie atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The brakes scraighs as the car came to a sudden stop.

meanings.sent1: The scraighs of the chalk on the blackboard were unbearable.
meanings.sent2: The scraighs of the violin filled the concert hall with music.
meanings.sent3: The scraighs of the seagulls overhead added to the beach's charm.
meanings.sent4: The scraighs of the brakes echoed through the quiet street.
meanings.sent5: The scraighs of the microphone feedback startled the audience.
